title: 104_s2162
content: The "Mississippi Sioux Tribes Judgment Fund Distribution Act of 1996" defines terms like "covered Indian tribe" and "Secretary" for distribution of funds to the Sisseton and Wahpeton Tribes of Sioux Indians. The "Mississippi Sioux Tribes Judgment Fund Distribution Act of 1996" directs the distribution of funds from Public Law 90-352 to the Sisseton and Wahpeton Tribes of Sioux Indians in accordance with the Act. The Secretary will distribute funds to tribal governing bodies of specific tribes as follows: 28.9276% to Devils Lake Sioux Tribe, 57.3145% to Sisseton and Wahpeton Sioux Tribe, and 13.7579% to Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of Fort Peck Reservation. For fund distributions, the Sisseton and Wahpeton Sioux Council will govern the Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes of the Fort Peck Reservation. Establishment of Tribal Trust Funds: Each tribal governing body receiving funds must establish a trust fund for the benefit of the covered Indian tribe, consisting of deposited amounts and accrued interest. The tribal governing body will serve as the trustee and administer the trust fund in accordance with section 6. No funds from section 4 can be used for per capita payments to tribe members. The funds can only be used for economic development, resource development, or beneficial programs for tribe members. The Secretary will conduct annual audits to ensure compliance. The Secretary conducts annual audits to ensure that tribal governing bodies are managing trust funds in compliance with requirements. If a tribe is found non-compliant, they must take remedial action or appoint an independent trustee. If a covered Indian tribe fails to take remedial action within a specified time, the Secretary will appoint an independent trustee to manage the trust fund established by the tribe. SEC. 7 of the Act states that payments to covered Indian tribes or individuals will not affect their eligibility for federal services or programs, and will not be subject to income tax. SEC. 8 addresses the distribution of funds to lineal descendants. SEC. 8 of the Act mandates the distribution of $1,469,831.50 to lineal descendants of the Sisseton and Wahpeton Tribes of Sioux Indians within a year of the Act's enactment.
